trans-unit.source: Moves Pegman forward or backward one space.
trans-unit.note: tooltip (pop-up help) - Pegman is the humanoid icon used in Google Maps. See picture at http://goo.gl/9I64i (http://maps.google.com/intl/en/help/maps/streetview/learn/pegman.html). The term 'space' refers to a single square within a maze.
Maze.moveTooltip

trans-unit.source: If there is a path in the specified direction, \nthen do some actions.
trans-unit.note: tooltip (pop-up help) - 'path' refers to a path through a maze.
Maze.ifTooltip

trans-unit.source: Turns Pegman left or right by 90 degrees.
trans-unit.note: tooltip (pop-up help) - Pegman is the humanoid icon used in Google Maps. See picture at http://goo.gl/9I64i (http://maps.google.com/intl/en/help/maps/streetview/learn/pegman.html). The term 'space' refers to a single square within a maze.
Maze.turnTooltip
verb - imperative or infinitive preceding one or more commands to a person.
Maze.ifDo
adverb - to modify the term for a path through a maze, as in: 'if path behind, move backward'.
Maze.behind

trans-unit.source: Returns Pegman's vertical position. Top edge is 1, bottom edge is 8.
trans-unit.note: tooltip (pop-up help) - Pegman is the humanoid icon used in Google Maps. See picture at http://goo.gl/9I64i (http://maps.google.com/intl/en/help/maps/streetview/learn/pegman.html).
Maze.getYTooltip

trans-unit.source: Repeat the enclosed actions until finish point is reached.
trans-unit.note: tooltip (pop-up help) - Repeat the enclosed commands until the maze has been successfully completed (the end point reached).
Maze.whileTooltip
verb - imperative or infinitive for a person moving (walking). The word for 'forward' or 'backward' will be attached to it later.
Maze.move
adverb - to modify the word for 'move', describing an individual person's movement.
Maze.forward
adverb - to modify the term for a path through a maze, as in: 'if path to the right, end game'.
Maze.toTheRight
adverb - to modify the word for 'turn', describing an individual person's change in direction of 90 degrees clockwise.
Maze.left

trans-unit.source: Returns Pegman's horizontal position. Left edge is 1, right edge is 8.
trans-unit.note: tooltip (pop-up help) - Pegman is the humanoid icon used in Google Maps. See picture at http://goo.gl/9I64i (http://maps.google.com/intl/en/help/maps/streetview/learn/pegman.html).
Maze.getXTooltip
tooltip (pop-up help) for button; pressing the button causes the user's program to be saved and for a URL to be provided for retrieving it. The word 'blocks' is as in children's toy blocks.
Maze.linkTooltip
warning - Only one more block may be added.
Maze.capacity1
noun - This word appears on a link on another page to direct users to this maze tutorial.
Maze.title
warning - No more blocks may be added until some are removed.
Maze.capacity0

trans-unit.source: Returns true if there is a path in the specified direction.
trans-unit.note: tooltip (pop-up help) - 'path' refers to a path through a maze.
Maze.isPathTooltip
warning - Only %1 more blocks may be used, where %1 is an integer greater than 1.
Maze.capacity2

trans-unit.source: What is the sequence of steps to follow this path?
trans-unit.note: instructions - the word 'steps' refers to instructions in a computer program; 'path' refers to the path through a maze. See previous description for tense.
Maze.instructions2
button label - Pressing the button causes Pegman return to the start of the maze (but does not delete the user's program.)
Maze.runProgram
tooltip (pop-up help) for button; pressing the button causes the start marker and finish markers in the current maze to be moved to random locations, without othwerise changing the maze.
Maze.randomizeTooltip1

trans-unit.source: A program is a sequence of blocks. Stack a couple of 'move forward' blocks together to help me reach the goal.
trans-unit.note: instructions - the word 'program' refers to a computer program, and thewords for 'stack' and 'blocks' should be the same as for stacking children's blocks. Use the imperative verb form appropriate for speaking to a child, gender unspecified. If no gender-neutral singular/familiar form exists but a gender-neutral plural/formal form exists, use that instead.
Maze.instructions1
adverb - to modify the term for a path through a maze, as in: 'if path to the left, move backward'.
Maze.toTheLeft
verb - imperative or infinitive to repeat the following commands until the program is finished (the end of a maze has been reached).
Maze.repeatUntilFinished
noun - This refers to the level in a game and will be followed by a number, as in 'Level 1' (the beginning level) or 'Level 10' (the final level).
Maze.level
adverb - to modify the term for a path through a maze, as in: 'if path ahead, go forward'.
Maze.ahead
button label - Pressing the button runs the computer program the user has written.
runProgram

trans-unit.source: On this level, you need to stack together all of the blocks in the white workspace.
trans-unit.note: alert - This is displayed if a user attempts to run a program composed of multiple stacks of blocks, letting them know they need to create a single stack.
Maze.oneTopBlock

trans-unit.source: Computers have limited memory. Reach the end of this path using only two blocks. Use 'repeat' to run a block more than once.
trans-unit.note: instructions - 'path' refers to a path through a maze, and 'block' refers to a child's building block.
Maze.instructions3
verb - imperative or infinitive for a person moving (walking) in the direction he is facing. Prefer a translation that has text in common with the translation of 'move backward'.
Maze.moveForward

trans-unit.source: This maze looks more complicated than the previous one, but it is not.
trans-unit.note: instructions displayed along with a new maze for the user to solve.
Maze.instructions7

trans-unit.source: Retuns Pegman's direction. North: 0, East: 1, South: 2, West: 3.
trans-unit.note: tooltip (pop-up help) - Pegman is the humanoid icon used in Google Maps. See picture at http://goo.gl/9I64i (http://maps.google.com/intl/en/help/maps/streetview/learn/pegman.html).
Maze.getDirectionTooltip

tooltip (pop-up help) - Pegman is the humanoid icon used in Google Maps. See picture at http://goo.gl/9I64i (http://maps.google.com/intl/en/help/maps/streetview/learn/pegman.html). The term 'space' refers to a single square within a maze.
Maze.moveForwardToolTip

trans-unit.source: Can you solve this complicated maze? Try following the left-hand wall. Advanced programmers only!
trans-unit.note: instructions - This advises the user to solve a maze by keeping his/her left hand in contact with the wall while proceding through it. The final sentence is a warning that only advanced programmers should attempt this problem, as beginners tend to get frustrated.
Maze.instructions10

trans-unit.source: Pegman will have to turn left when he cannot go straight.
trans-unit.note: instructions - 'turn left' refers to rotating in place a quarter circle counter-clockwise.
Maze.instructions5
verb - imperative or infinitive for a person turning his head and body to face a different direction. The modifier 'right', 'left', or 'randomly' will be attached to it later.
Maze.turn
tooltip (pop-up help) for button; pressing the button causes a program in the JavaScript computer language to be displayed, based on the program created by the user.
Maze.codeTooltip
verb - imperative or infinitive to obtain the vertical coordinate of a point in a two-dimensional plane (e.g., how far down (south) a player is.)
Maze.getY
verb - imperative or infinitive to obtain the direction (north, south, east, or west) a player is facing.
Maze.getDirection
adverb - to modify the word for 'move', describing an individual person's movement.
Maze.backward

trans-unit.source: If there is a path in the specified direction, then do the first block of actions. Otherwise, do the second block of actions.
trans-unit.note: tooltip (pop-up help) - 'path' refers to a path through a maze.
Maze.ifelseTooltip
noun - describing one or more commands that will be executed if some condition is true. This can also be translated as 'true path'.
Maze.ifPath
conjunction - 'otherwise', introducing commands to be performed if a previous condition was not true, as in 'if x>3, do this, else do that'.
Maze.ifElse

trans-unit.source: Congratulations! You have solved the final level.
trans-unit.note: alert - This is displayed when the user solves the most difficult level.
Maze.finalLevel

trans-unit.source: Congratulations! Are you ready to proceed to level %1?
trans-unit.note: alert - This is displayed when the user solves the maze, inviting them to precede to the next level of difficulty. %1 is an integer greater than 1.
Maze.nextLevel
adverb - to modify the word for 'turn', indicating that whether a person turns left or right is being left to chance.
Maze.randomly
adverb - to modify the word for 'turn', describing an individual person's change in direction of 90 degrees counter-clockwise.
Maze.right

trans-unit.source: If-else blocks will do one thing or the other.
trans-unit.note: instructions - 'block' refers to a child's building block. For 'if-else' concatenate the words for 'if' and 'else/otherwise'.
Maze.instructions9

trans-unit.source: An 'if' block will do something only if the condition is true. Try turning left if there is a path to the left.
trans-unit.note: instructions - an example of an 'if' block is: 'if there is a path to the left, turn left'.
Maze.instructions6

trans-unit.source: Reach the goal using only five blocks.
trans-unit.note: instructions - the goal is reaching the end point in a maze; 'block' refers to a child's building block.
Maze.instructions4
noun - a path through a maze, to be modified later by a direction, as in 'is there a path ahead'.
Maze.path

trans-unit.source: You can use more than one 'if' block.
trans-unit.note: instructions - 'block' refers to a child's building block.
Maze.instructions8
verb - imperative or infinitive to obtain the horizontal coordinate of a point in a two-dimensional plane (e.g., how far to the right (east) a player is.)
Maze.getX
